summary.long: Leviticus is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: And Jehovah calleth unto Moses, and speaketh unto him out of the tent of meeting, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, and thou hast said unto them, Any man of you when he doth bring near an offering to Jehovah, out of the cattle -- out of the herd, or out of the flock -- ye do bring near your offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `If his offering [is] a burnt-offering out of the herd -- a male, a perfect one, he doth bring near, unto the opening of the tent of meeting he doth bring it near, at his pleasure, before Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath laid his hand on the head of the burnt-offering, and it hath been accepted for him to make atonement for him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath slaughtered the son of the herd before Jehovah; and sons of Aaron, the priests, have brought the blood near, and sprinkled the blood on the altar round about, which [is] at the opening of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he hath stripped the burnt-offering, and hath cut it into its pieces;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Aaron the priest have put fire on the altar, and arranged wood on the fire;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sons of Aaron, the priests, have arranged the pieces, with the head and the fat, on the wood, which [is] on the fire, which [is] on the altar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and its inwards and its legs he doth wash with water; and the priest hath made perfume with the whole on the altar, a burnt-offering, a fire-offering of sweet fragrance to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if his offering [is] out of the flock -- out of the sheep or out of the goats -- for a burnt-offering, a male, a perfect one, he doth bring near,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath slaughtered it by the side of the altar northward, before Jehovah; and sons of Aaron, the priests, have sprinkled its blood on the altar round about;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath cut it into its pieces, and its head and its fat, and the priest hath arranged them on the wood, which [is] on the fire, which [is] on the altar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the inwards and the legs he doth wash with water, and the priest hath brought the whole near, and hath made perfume on the altar; it [is] a burnt-offering, a fire-offering of sweet fragrance to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if his offering [is] a burnt-offering out of the fowl to Jehovah, than he hath brought near his offering out of the turtle-doves or out of the young pigeons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath brought it near unto the altar, and hath wrung off its head, and hath made perfume on the altar, and its blood hath been wrung out by the side of the altar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath turned aside its crop with its feathers, and hath cast it near the altar, eastward, unto the place of ashes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath cleaved it with its wings (he doth not separate [it]), and the priest hath made it a perfume on the altar, on the wood, which [is] on the fire; it [is] a burnt-offering, a fire-offering of sweet fragrance to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a person bringeth near an offering, a present to Jehovah, of flour is his offering, and he hath poured on it oil, and hath put on it frankincense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath brought it in unto the sons of Aaron, the priests, and he hath taken from thence the fulness of his hand of its flour and of its oil, besides all its frankincense, and the priest hath made perfume with its memorial on the altar, a fire-offering of sweet fragrance to Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the remnant of the present [is] for Aaron and for his sons, most holy, of the fire-offerings of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when thou bringest near an offering, a present baked in an oven, [it is of] unleavened cakes of flour mixed with oil, or thin unleavened cakes anointed with oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if thine offering [is] a present [made] on the girdel, it is of flour, mixed with oil, unleavened;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: divide thou it into parts, and thou hast poured on it oil; it [is] a present.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if thine offering [is] a present [made] on the frying-pan, of flour with oil it is made,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast brought in the present which is made of these to Jehovah, and [one] hath brought it near unto the priest, and he hath brought it nigh unto the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath lifted up from the present its memorial, and hath made perfume on the altar, a fire-offering of sweet fragrance to Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the remnant of the present [is] for Aaron and for his sons, most holy, of the fire-offerings of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No present which ye bring near to Jehovah is made fermented, for with any leaven or any honey ye perfume no fire-offering to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `An offering of first-[fruits] -- ye bring them near to Jehovah, but on the altar they go not up, for sweet fragrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every offering -- thy present -- with salt thou dost season, and thou dost not let the salt of the covenant of thy God cease from thy present; with all thine offerings thou dost bring near salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if thou bring near a present of first-ripe [fruits] to Jehovah, -- of green ears, roasted with fire, beaten out [corn] of a fruitful field thou dost bring near the present of thy first-ripe [fruits],
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast put on it oil, and laid on it frankincense, it [is] a present;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath made perfume with its memorial from its beaten out [corn], and from its oil, besides all its frankincense -- a fire-offering to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if his offering [is] a sacrifice of peace-offerings, if out of the herd he is bringing near, whether male or female, a perfect one he doth bring near before Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath laid his hand on the head of his offering, and hath slaughtered it at the opening of the tent of meeting, and sons of Aaron, the priests, have sprinkled the blood on the altar round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he hath brought near from the sacrifice of the peace-offerings a fire-offering to Jehovah, the fat which is covering the inwards, and all the fat which [is] on the inwards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the two kidneys, and the fat which [is] on them, which [is] on the flanks, and the redundance above the liver, (beside the kidneys he doth turn it aside),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sons of Aaron have made it a perfume on the altar, on the burnt-offering which [is] on the wood, which [is] on the fire -- a fire-offering of sweet fragrance to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if his offering [is] out of the flock for a sacrifice of peace-offerings to Jehovah, male or female, a perfect one he doth bring near;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if a sheep he is bringing near [for] his offering, then he hath brought it near before Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hath laid his hand on the head of his offering, and hath slaughtered it before the tent of meeting, and sons of Aaron have sprinkled its blood on the altar round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he hath brought near from the sacrifice of the peace-offerings a fire-offering to Jehovah, its fat, the whole fat tail (over-against the bone he doth turn it aside), and the fat which is covering the inwards, and all the fat which [is] on the inwards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the two kidneys, and the fat which [is] on them, which [is] on the flanks, and the redundance above the liver, (beside the kidneys he doth turn it aside),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath made it a perfume on the altar -- bread of a fire-offering to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if his offering [is] a goat, then he hath brought it near before Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hath laid his hand on its head, and hath slaughtered it before the tent of meeting, and sons of Aaron have sprinkled its blood on the altar round about;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath brought near from it his offering, a fire-offering to Jehovah, the fat which is covering the inwards, and all the fat which [is] on the inwards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the two kidneys, and the fat which [is] upon them, which [is] on the flanks, and the redundance above the liver, (beside the kidneys he doth turn it aside),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath made them a perfume on the altar -- bread of a fire-offering, for sweet fragrance; all the fat [is] Jehovah's.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `A statute age-during to your generations in all your dwellings: any fat or any blood ye do not eat.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, saying, When a person doth sin through ignorance against any of the commands of Jehovah [regarding things] which are not to be done, and hath done [something] against one of these --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `If the priest who is anointed doth sin according to the guilt of the people, then he hath brought near for his sin which he hath sinned a bullock, a son of the herd, a perfect one, to Jehovah, for a sin-offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath brought in the bullock unto the opening of the tent of meeting before Jehovah, and hath laid his hand on the head of the bullock, and hath slaughtered the bullock before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest who is anointed hath taken of the blood of the bullock, and hath brought it in unto the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath dipped his finger in the blood, and sprinkled of the blood seven times before Jehovah, at the front of the vail of the sanctuary;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath put of the blood on the horns of the altar of spice-perfume before Jehovah, which [is] in the tent of meeting, and all the blood of the bullock he doth pour out at the foundation of the altar of the burnt-offering, which [is] at the opening of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And all the fat of the bullock of the sin-offering he doth lift up from it, the fat which is covering over the inwards, and all the fat which [is] on the inwards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the two kidneys, and the fat which [is] on them, which [is] on the flanks, and the redundance above the liver, (beside the kidneys he doth turn it aside),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as it is lifted up from the ox of the sacrifice of the peace-offerings; and the priest hath made them a perfume on the altar of the burnt-offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the skin of the bullock, and all its flesh, besides its head, and besides its legs, and its inwards, and its dung --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he hath even brought out the whole bullock unto the outside of the camp, unto a clean place, unto the place of the pouring out of the ashes, and he hath burnt it on the wood with fire; beside the place of the pouring out of the ashes it is burnt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if the whole company of Israel err ignorantly, and the thing hath been hidden from the eyes of the assembly, and they have done [something against] one of all the commands of Jehovah [concerning things] which are not to be done, and have been guilty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the sin which they have sinned concerning it hath been known, then have the assembly brought near a bullock, a son of the herd, for a sin-offering, and they have brought it in before the tent of meeting;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the elders of the company have laid their hands on the head of the bullock, before Jehovah, and [one] hath slaughtered the bullock before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest who is anointed hath brought in of the blood of the bullock unto the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath dipped his finger in the blood, and hath sprinkled seven times before Jehovah at the front of the vail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and [some] of the blood he doth put on the horns of the altar which [is] before Jehovah, which [is] in the tent of meeting; and all the blood he doth pour out at the foundation of the altar of the burnt-offering, which [is] at the opening of the tent of meeting;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all its fat he doth lift up from it, and hath made perfume on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he hath done to the bullock as he hath done to the bullock of the sin-offering, so he doth to it; and the priest hath made atonement for them, and it hath been forgiven them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath brought out the bullock unto the outside of the camp, and hath burned it as he hath burned the first bullock; it [is] a sin-offering of the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a prince doth sin, and hath done [something against] one of all the commands of Jehovah his God [regarding things] which are not to be done, through ignorance, and hath been guilty --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or his sin wherein he hath sinned hath been made known unto him, then he hath brought in his offering, a kid of the goats, a male, a perfect one,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath laid his hand on the head of the goat, and hath slaughtered it in the place where he doth slaughter the burnt-offering before Jehovah; it [is] a sin-offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest hath taken of the blood of the sin-offering with his finger, and hath put on the horns of the altar of the burnt-offering, and its blood he doth pour out at the foundation of the altar of the burnt-offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with all its fat he doth make perfume on the altar, as the fat of the sacrifice of the peace-offerings; and the priest hath made atonement for him because of his sin, and it hath been forgiven him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if any person of the people of the land sin through ignorance, by his doing [something against] one of the commands of Jehovah [regarding things] which are not to be done, and hath been guilty --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or his sin which he hath sinned hath been made known unto him, then he hath brought in his offering, a kid of the goats, a perfect one, a female, for his sin which he hath sinned,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath laid his hand on the head of the sin-offering, and hath slaughtered the sin-offering in the place of the burnt-offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest hath taken of its blood with his finger, and hath put on the horns of the altar of the burnt-offering, and all its blood he doth pour out at the foundation of the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all its fat he doth turn aside, as the fat hath been turned aside from off the sacrifice of the peace-offerings, and the priest hath made perfume on the altar, for sweet fragrance to Jehovah; and the priest hath made atonement for him, and it hath been forgiven him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if he bring in a sheep [for] his offering, for a sin-offering, a female, a perfect one, he doth bring in,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath laid his hand on the head of the sin-offering, and hath slaughtered it for a sin-offering in the place where he slaughtereth the burnt-offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest hath taken of the blood of the sin-offering with his finger, and hath put on the horns of the altar of the burnt-offering, and all its blood he poureth out at the foundation of the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all its fat he turneth aside, as the fat of the sheep is turned aside from the sacrifice of the peace-offerings, and the priest hath made them a perfume on the altar, according to the fire-offerings of Jehovah, and the priest hath made atonement for him, for his sin which he hath sinned, and it hath been forgiven him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a person doth sin, and hath heard the voice of an oath, and he [is] witness, or hath seen, or hath known -- if he declare not, then he hath borne his iniquity:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Or when a person cometh against any thing unclean, or against a carcase of an unclean beast, or against a carcase of unclean cattle, or against a carcase of an unclean teeming creature, and it hath been hidden from him, and he unclean, and guilty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Or when he cometh against uncleanness of man, even any of his uncleanness whereby he is unclean, and it hath been hidden from him, and he hath known, and hath been guilty:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Or when a person sweareth, speaking wrongfully with the lips to do evil, or to do good, even anything which man speaketh wrongfully with an oath, and it hath been hid from him; -- when he hath known then he hath been guilty of one of these;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been when he is guilty of one of these, that he hath confessed concerning that which he hath sinned,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hath brought in his guilt-offering to Jehovah for his sin which he hath sinned, a female out of the flock, a lamb, or a kid of the goats, for a sin-offering, and the priest hath made atonement for him, because of his sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if his hand reach not to the sufficiency of a lamb, then he hath brought in his guilt-offering -- he who hath sinned -- two turtle-doves or two young pigeons to Jehovah, one for a sin-offering, and one for a burnt-offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath brought them in unto the priest, and hath brought near that which [is] for a sin-offering first, and hath wrung off its head from its neck, and doth not separate [it],
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath sprinkled of the blood of the sin-offering on the side of the altar, and that which is left of the blood is wrung out at the foundation of the altar; it [is] a sin-offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the second he maketh a burnt-offering, according to the ordinance, and the priest hath made atonement for him, because of his sin which he hath sinned, and it hath been forgiven him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if his hand reach not to two turtle-doves, or to two young pigeons, then he hath brought in his offering -- he who hath sinned -- a tenth of an ephah of flour for a sin-offering; he putteth no oil on it, nor doth he put on it frankincense, for it [is] a sin-offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath brought it in unto the priest, and the priest hath taken a handful from it -- the fulness of his hand -- its memorial -- and hath made perfume on the altar, according to the fire-offerings of Jehovah; it [is] a sin-offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest hath made atonement for him, for his sin which he hath sinned against one of these, and it hath been forgiven him, and [the remnant] hath been to the priest, like the present.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a person committeth a trespass, and hath sinned through ignorance against the holy things of Jehovah, then he hath brought in his guilt-offering to Jehovah, a ram, a perfect one, out of the flock, at thy valuation [in] silver -- shekels by the shekel of the sanctuary -- for a guilt-offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And that which he hath sinned against the holy thing he repayeth, and its fifth is adding to it, and hath given it to the priest, and the priest maketh atonement for him with the ram of the guilt-offering, and it hath been forgiven him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when any person sinneth, and hath done [something against] one of all the commands of Jehovah [regarding things] which are not to be done, and hath not known, and he hath been guilty, and hath borne his iniquity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Then he hath brought in a ram, a perfect one, out of the flock, at thy valuation, for a guilt-offering, unto the priest; and the priest hath made atonement for him, for his ignorance in which he hath erred and he hath not known, and it hath been forgiven him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it [is] a guilt-offering; he hath been certainly guilty before Jehovah.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When any person doth sin, and hath committed a trespass against Jehovah, and hath lied to his fellow concerning a deposit, or concerning fellowship, or concerning violent robbery, or hath oppressed his fellow;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or hath found a lost thing, and hath lied concerning it, and hath sworn to a falsehood, concerning one of all [these] which man doth, sinning in them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Then it hath been, when he sinneth, and hath been guilty, that he hath returned the plunder which he hath taken violently away, or the thing which he hath got by oppression, or the deposit which hath been deposited with him, or the lost thing which he hath found;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or all that concerning which he sweareth falsely, he hath even repaid it in its principal, and its fifth he is adding to it; to him whose it [is] he giveth it in the day of his guilt-offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And his guilt-offering he bringeth in to Jehovah, a ram, a perfect one, out of the flock, at thy estimation, for a guilt-offering, unto the priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath made atonement for him before Jehovah, and it hath been forgiven him, concerning one thing of all that he doth, by being guilty therein.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Command Aaron and his sons, saying, This [is] a law of the burnt-offering (it [is] the burnt-offering, because of the burning on the altar all the night unto the morning, and the fire of the altar is burning on it,)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the priest hath put on his long robe of fine linen, and his fine linen trousers he doth put on his flesh, and hath lifted up the ashes which the fire consumeth with the burnt-offering on the altar, and hath put them near the altar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath stripped off his garments, and hath put on other garments, and hath brought out the ashes unto the outside of the camp, unto a clean place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the fire on the altar is burning on it, it is not quenched, and the priest hath burned on it wood morning by morning, and hath arranged on it the burnt-offering, and hath made perfume on it [with] the fat of the peace-offerings;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: fire is continually burning on the altar, it is not quenched.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And this [is] a law of the present: sons of Aaron have brought it near before Jehovah unto the front of the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and [one] hath lifted up of it with his hand from the flour of the present, and from its oil, and all the frankincense which [is] on the present, and hath made perfume on the altar, sweet fragrance -- its memorial to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the remnant of it do Aaron and his sons eat; [with] unleavened things it is eaten, in the holy place, in the court of the tent of meeting they do eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not baken [with] any thing fermented, their portion I have given it, out of My fire-offerings; it [is] most holy, like the sin-offering, and like the guilt-offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every male among the sons of Aaron doth eat it -- a statute age-during to your generations, out of the fire-offerings of Jehovah: all that cometh against them is holy.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This [is] an offering of Aaron and of his sons, which they bring near to Jehovah in the day of his being anointed; a tenth of the ephah of flour [for] a continual present, half of it in the morning, and half of it in the evening;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on a girdel with oil it is made -- fried thou dost bring it in; baked pieces of the present thou dost bring near, a sweet fragrance to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest who is anointed in his stead, from among his sons, doth make it, -- a statute age-during of Jehovah: it is completely perfumed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every present of a priest is a whole burnt-offering; it is not eaten.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto Aaron and unto his sons, saying, This [is] a law of the sin-offering: in the place where the burnt-offering is slaughtered is the sin-offering slaughtered before Jehovah; it [is] most holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The priest who is making atonement with it doth eat it, in the holy place it is eaten, in the court of the tent of meeting;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all that cometh against its flesh is holy, and when [any] of its blood is sprinkled on the garment, that on which it is sprinkled thou dost wash in the holy place;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and an earthen vessel in which it is boiled is broken, and if in a brass vessel it is boiled, then it is scoured and rinsed with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Every male among the priests doth eat it -- it [is] most holy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and no sin-offering, [any] of whose blood is brought in unto the tent of meeting to make atonement in the sanctuary is eaten; with fire it is burnt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And this [is] a law of the guilt-offering: it [is] most holy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the place where they slaughter the burnt-offering they do slaughter the guilt-offering, and its blood [one] doth sprinkle on the altar round about,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all its fat he bringeth near out of it, the fat tail, and the fat which is covering the inwards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the two kidneys, and the fat which [is] on them, which [is] on the flanks, and the redundance above the liver (beside the kidneys he doth turn it aside);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath made them a perfume on the altar, a fire-offering to Jehovah; it [is] a guilt-offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Every male among the priests doth eat it; in the holy place it is eaten -- it [is] most holy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as [is] a sin-offering, so [is] a guilt-offering; one law [is] for them; the priest who maketh atonement by it -- it is his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest who is bringing near any man's burnt-offering, the skin of the burnt-offering which he hath brought near, it is the priest's, his own;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every present which is baked in an oven, and every one done in a frying-pan, and on a girdel, [is] the priest's who is bringing it near; it is his;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every present, mixed with oil or dry, is for all the sons of Aaron -- one as another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And this [is] a law of the sacrifice of the peace-offerings which [one] bringeth near to Jehovah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if for a thank-offering he bring it near, then he hath brought near with the sacrifice of thank-offering unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and thin unleavened cakes anointed with oil, and of fried flour cakes mixed with oil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: besides the cakes, fermented bread he doth bring near [with] his offering, besides the sacrifice of thank-offering of his peace-offerings;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath brought near out of it one of the whole offering -- a heave-offering to Jehovah; to the priest who is sprinkling the blood of the peace-offerings -- it is his;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as to the flesh of the sacrifice of the thank-offering of his peace-offerings, in the day of his offering it is eaten; he doth not leave of it till morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if the sacrifice of his offering [is] a vow or free-will offering, in the day of his bringing near his sacrifice it is eaten; and on the morrow also the remnant of it is eaten;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the remnant of the flesh of the sacrifice on the third day with fire is burnt;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace-offerings be really eaten on the third day, it is not pleasing; for him who is bringing it near it is not reckoned; it is an abominable thing, and the person who is eating of it his iniquity doth bear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the flesh which cometh against any unclean thing is not eaten; with fire it is burnt; as to the flesh, every clean one doth eat of the flesh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the person who eateth of the flesh of the sacrifice of the peace-offerings which [are] Jehovah's, and his uncleanness upon him, even that person hath been cut off from his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a person cometh against any thing unclean, of the uncleanness of man, or of the uncleanness of beasts, or of any unclean teeming creature, and hath eaten of the flesh of the sacrifice of the peace-offerings which [are] Jehovah's, even that person hath been cut off from his people.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, saying, Any fat of ox and sheep and goat ye do not eat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fat of a carcase, and the fat of a torn thing is prepared for any work, but ye do certainly not eat it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for whoever eateth the fat of the beast, of which [one] bringeth near a fire-offering to Jehovah, even the person who eateth hath been cut off from his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And any blood ye do not eat in all your dwellings, of fowl, or of beast;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: any person who eateth any blood, even that person hath been cut off from his people.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, saying, He who is bringing near the sacrifice of his peace-offerings to Jehovah doth bring in his offering to Jehovah from the sacrifice of his peace-offerings;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his own hands do bring in the fire-offerings of Jehovah, the fat beside the breast, it he doth bring in with the breast, to wave it -- a wave-offering before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest hath made perfume with the fat on the altar, and the breast hath been Aaron's and his sons;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the right leg ye do make a heave-offering to the priest of the sacrifices of your peace-offerings;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he of the sons of Aaron who is bringing near the blood of the peace-offerings, and the fat, his is the right leg for a portion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `For the breast of the wave-offering, and the leg of the heave-offering, I have taken from the sons of Israel, from the sacrifices of their peace-offerings, and I give them to Aaron the priest, and to his sons, by a statute age-during, from the sons of Israel.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This [is] the anointing of Aaron, and the anointing of his sons out of the fire-offerings of Jehovah, in the day he hath brought them near to act as priest to Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which Jehovah hath commanded to give to them in the day of His anointing them, from the sons of Israel -- a statute age-during to their generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This [is] the law for burnt-offering, for present, and for sin-offering, and for guilt-offering, and for consecrations, and for a sacrifice of the peace-offerings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which Jehovah hath commanded Moses in Mount Sinai, in the day of his commanding the sons of Israel to bring near their offerings to Jehovah, in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Take Aaron and his sons with him, and the garments, and the anointing oil, and the bullock of the sin-offering, and the two rams, and the basket of unleavened things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the company assemble thou unto the opening of the tent of meeting.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses doth as Jehovah hath commanded him, and the company is assembled unto the opening of the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses saith unto the company, `This [is] the thing which Jehovah hath commanded to do.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses bringeth near Aaron and his sons, and doth bathe them with water,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and doth put on him the coat, and doth gird him with the girdle, and doth clothe him with the upper robe, and doth put on him the ephod, and doth gird him with the girdle of the ephod, and doth bind [it] to him with it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and doth put on him the breastplate, and doth put unto the breastplate the Lights and the Perfections,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and doth put the mitre on his head, and doth put on the mitre, over-against its front, the golden flower of the holy crown, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses taketh the anointing oil, and anointeth the tabernacle, and all that [is] in it, and sanctifieth them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he sprinkleth of it on the altar seven times, and anointeth the altar, and all its vessels, and the laver, and its base, to sanctify them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he poureth of the anointing oil on the head of Aaron, and anointeth him to sanctify him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses bringeth near the sons of Aaron, and doth clothe them [with] coats, and girdeth them [with] girdles, and bindeth for them turbans, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he bringeth nigh the bullock of the sin-offering, and Aaron layeth -- his sons also -- their hands on the head of the bullock of the sin-offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and [one] slaughtereth, and Moses taketh the blood, and putteth on the horns of the altar round about with his finger, and cleanseth the altar, and the blood he hath poured out at the foundation of the altar, and sanctifieth it, to make atonement upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he taketh all the fat that [is] on the inwards, and the redundance above the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat, and Moses maketh Perfume on the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the bullock, and its skin, and its flesh, and its dung, he hath burnt with fire, at the outside of the camp, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he bringeth near the ram of the burnt-offering, and Aaron and his sons lay their hands on the head of the ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and [one] slaughtereth, and Moses sprinkleth the blood on the altar round about;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the ram he hath cut into its pieces, and Moses maketh perfume with the head, and the pieces, and the fat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the inwards and the legs he hath washed with water, and Moses maketh perfume with the whole ram on the altar; it [is] a burnt-offering, for sweet fragrance; it [is] a fire-offering to Jehovah, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he bringeth near the second ram, a ram of the consecrations, and Aaron and his sons lay their hands on the head of the ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and [one] slaughtereth, and Moses taketh of its blood, and putteth on the tip of the right ear of Aaron, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the great toe of his right foot;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he bringeth near the sons of Aaron, and Moses putteth of the blood on the tip of their right ear, and on the thumb of their right hand, and on the great toe of their right foot. And Moses sprinkleth the blood on the altar round about,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and taketh the fat, and the fat tail, and all the fat that [is] on the inwards, and the redundance above the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat, and the right leg;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and out of the basket of unleavened things, which [is] before Jehovah, he hath taken one unleavened cake, and one cake of oiled bread, and one thin cake, and putteth [them] on the fat, and on the right leg;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and putteth the whole on the hands of Aaron, and on the hands of his sons, and waveth them -- a wave-offering before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses taketh them from off their hands, and maketh perfume on the altar, on the burnt-offering, they [are] consecrations for sweet fragrance; it [is] a fire-offering to Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses taketh the breast, and waveth it -- a wave-offering before Jehovah; of the ram of the consecrations it hath been to Moses for a portion, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses taketh of the anointing oil, and of the blood which [is] on the altar, and sprinkleth on Aaron, on his garments, and on his sons, and on the garments of his sons with him, and he sanctifieth Aaron, his garments, and his sons, and the garments of his sons with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith unto Aaron, and unto his sons, `Boil ye the flesh at the opening of the tent of meeting, and there ye do eat it and the bread which [is] in the basket of the consecrations, as I have commanded, saying, Aaron and his sons do eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the remnant of the flesh and of the bread with fire ye burn;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from the opening of the tent of meeting ye go not out seven days, till the day of the fulness, the days of your consecration -- for seven days he doth consecrate your hand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as he hath done on this day, Jehovah hath commanded to do, to make atonement for you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and at the opening of the tent of meeting ye abide, by day and by night seven days, and ye have kept the charge of Jehovah, and die not, for so I have been commanded.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron doth -- his sons also -- all the things which Jehovah hath commanded by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass on the eighth day, Moses hath called for Aaron and for his sons, and for the elders of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saith unto Aaron, `Take to thyself a calf, a son of the herd, for a sin-offering, and a ram for a burnt-offering, perfect ones, and bring near before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And unto the sons of Israel thou dost speak, saying, Take ye a kid of the goats for a sin-offering, and a calf, and a lamb, sons of a year, perfect ones, for a burnt-offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a bullock and a ram for peace-offerings, to sacrifice before Jehovah, and a present mixed with oil; for to-day Jehovah hath appeared unto you.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they take that which Moses hath commanded unto the front of the tent of meeting, and all the company draw near and stand before Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses saith, `This [is] the thing which Jehovah hath commanded; do [it], and the honour of Jehovah doth appear unto you.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith unto Aaron, `Draw near unto the altar, and make thy sin-offering, and thy burnt-offering, and make atonement for thyself, and for the people, and make the offering of the people, and make atonement for them, as Jehovah hath commanded.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron draweth near unto the altar, and slaughtereth the calf of the sin-offering, which [is] for himself;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Aaron bring the blood near unto him, and he dippeth his finger in the blood, and putteth [it] on the horns of the altar, and the blood he hath poured out at the foundation of the altar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fat, and the kidneys, and the redundance of the liver, of the sin-offering, he hath made a perfume on the altar, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the flesh and the skin he hath burnt with fire, at the outside of the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he slaughtereth the burnt-offering, and the sons of Aaron have presented unto him the blood, and he sprinkleth it on the altar round about;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the burnt-offering they have presented unto him, by its pieces, and the head, and he maketh perfume on the altar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he washeth the inwards and the legs, and maketh perfume for the burnt-offering on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he bringeth near the offering of the people, and taketh the goat of the sin-offering which [is] for the people, and slaughtered it, and maketh it a sin-offering, like the first;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he bringeth near the burnt-offering, and maketh it, according to the ordinance;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he bringeth near the present, and filleth his palm with it, and maketh perfume on the altar, apart from the burnt-offering of the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he slaughtereth the bullock and the ram, a sacrifice of the peace-offerings, which [are] for the people, and sons of Aaron present the blood unto him (and he sprinkleth it on the altar round about),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fat of the bullock, and of the ram, the fat tail, and the covering [of the inwards], and the kidneys, and the redundance above the liver,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they set the fat on the breasts, and he maketh perfume with the fat on the altar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the breasts, and the right leg hath Aaron waved -- a wave-offering before Jehovah, as He hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron lifteth up his hand towards the people, and blesseth them, and cometh down from making the sin-offering, and the burnt-offering, and the peace-offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses goeth in -- Aaron also -- unto the tent of meeting, and they come out, and bless the people, and the honour of Jehovah appeareth unto all the people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and fire cometh out from before Jehovah, and consumeth on the altar the burnt-offering, and the fat; and all the people see, and cry aloud, and fall on their faces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, take each his censer, and put in them fire, and put on it perfume, and bring near before Jehovah strange fire, which He hath not commanded them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and fire goeth out from before Jehovah, and consumeth them, and they die before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith unto Aaron, `It [is] that which Jehovah hath spoken, saying, By those drawing near to Me I am sanctified, and in the face of all the people I am honoured;' and Aaron is silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses calleth unto Mishael and unto Elzaphan, sons of Uzziel, uncle of Aaron, and saith unto them, `Come near, bear your brethren from the front of the sanctuary unto the outside of the camp;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they come near, and bear them in their coats unto the outside of the camp, as Moses hath spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith unto Aaron, and to Eleazar, and to Ithamar his sons, `Your heads ye do not uncover, and your garments ye do not rend, that ye die not, and on all the company He be wroth; as to your brethren, the whole house of Israel, they bewail the burning which Jehovah hath kindled;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from the opening of the tent of meeting ye do not go out, lest ye die, for the anointing oil of Jehovah [is] upon you;' and they do according to the word of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Wine and strong drink thou dost not drink, thou, and thy sons with thee, in your going in unto the tent of meeting, and ye die not -- a statute age-during to your generations;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so as to make a separation between the holy and the common, and between the unclean and the pure;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to teach the sons of Israel all the statutes which Jehovah hath spoken unto them by the hand of Moses.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses speaketh unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar, and unto Ithamar his sons, who are left, `Take ye the present that is left from the fire-offerings of Jehovah, and eat it unleavened near the altar, for it [is] most holy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have eaten it in the holy place, for it [is] thy portion, and the portion of thy sons, from the fire-offerings of Jehovah; for so I have been commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the breast of the wave-offering, and the leg of the heave-offering, ye do eat in a clean place, thou, and thy sons, and thy daughters with thee; for thy portion and the portion of thy sons they have been given, out of the sacrifices of peace-offerings of the sons of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the leg of the heave-offering, and breast of the wave-offering, besides fire-offerings of the fat, they do bring in to wave a wave-offering before Jehovah, and it hath been to thee, and to thy sons with thee, by a statute age-during, as Jehovah hath commanded.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the goat of the sin-offering hath Moses diligently sought, and lo, it is burnt, and he is wroth against Eleazar, and against Ithamar, sons of Aaron, who are left, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Wherefore have ye not eaten the sin-offering in the holy place, for it [is] most holy -- and it He hath given to you to take away the iniquity of the company, to make atonement for them before Jehovah?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lo, its blood hath not been brought in unto the holy place within; eating ye do eat it in the holy place, as I have commanded.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron speaketh unto Moses, `Lo, to-day they have brought near their sin-offering and their burnt-offering before Jehovah; and [things] like these meet me, yet I have eaten a sin-offering to-day; is it good in the eyes of Jehovah?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses hearkeneth, and it is good in his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, saying, This [is] the beast which ye do eat out of all the beasts which [are] on the earth:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: any dividing a hoof, and cleaving the cleft of the hoofs, bringing up the cud, among the beasts, it ye do eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Only, this ye do not eat -- of those bringing up the cud, and of those dividing the hoof -- the camel, though it is bringing up the cud, yet the hoof not dividing -- it [is] unclean to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the rabbit, though it is bringing up the cud, yet the hoof it divideth not -- unclean it [is] to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the hare, though it is bringing up the cud, yet the hoof hath not divided -- unclean it [is] to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sow, though it is dividing the hoof, and cleaving the cleft of the hoof, yet the cud it bringeth not up -- unclean it [is] to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Of their flesh ye do not eat, and against their carcase ye do not come -- unclean they [are] to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This ye do eat of all which [are] in the waters; any one that hath fins and scales in the waters, in the seas, and in the brooks, them ye do eat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and any one that hath not fins and scales in the seas, and in the brooks, of any teeming creature of the waters, and of any creature which liveth, which [is] in the waters -- an abomination they [are] to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yea, an abomination they are to you; of their flesh ye do not eat, and their carcase ye abominate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Any one that hath not fins and scales in the waters -- an abomination it [is] to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And these ye do abominate of the fowl; they are not eaten, an abomination they [are]: the eagle, and the ossifrage, and the ospray,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the vulture, and the kite after its kind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: every raven after its kind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the owl, and the night-hawk, and the cuckoo, and the hawk after its kind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the little owl, and the cormorant, and the great owl,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the swan, and the pelican, and the gier eagle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the stork, the heron after its kind, and the lapwing, and the bat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Every teeming creature which is flying, which is going on four -- an abomination it [is] to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Only -- this ye do eat of any teeming thing which is flying, which is going on four, which hath legs above its feet, to move with them on the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: these of them ye do eat: the locust after its kind, and the bald locust after its kind, and the beetle after its kind, and the grasshopper after its kind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every teeming thing which is flying, which hath four feet -- an abomination it [is] to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And by these ye are made unclean, any one who is coming against their carcase is unclean till the evening;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and anyone who is lifting up [aught] of their carcase doth wash his garments, and hath been unclean till the evening: --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even every beast which is dividing the hoof, and is not cloven-footed, and the cud is not bringing up -- unclean they [are] to you; any one who is coming against them is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And any one going on its paws, among all the beasts which are going on four -- unclean they [are] to you; any one who is coming against their carcase is unclean until the evening;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he who is lifting up their carcase doth wash his garments, and hath been unclean until the evening -- unclean they [are] to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And this [is] to you the unclean among the teeming things which are teeming on the earth: the weasel, and the mouse, and the tortoise after its kind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the ferret, and the chameleon, and the lizard, and the snail, and the mole;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: these [are] the unclean to you among all which are teeming; any one who is coming against them in their death is unclean till the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And anything on which any one of them falleth, in their death, is unclean, of any vessel of wood or garment or skin or sack, any vessel in which work is done is brought into water, and hath been unclean till the evening, then it hath been clean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and any earthen vessel, into the midst of which [any] one of them falleth, all that [is] in its midst is unclean, and it ye do break.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Of all the food which is eaten, that on which cometh [such] water, is unclean, and all drink which is drunk in any [such] vessel is unclean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and anything on which [any] of their carcase falleth is unclean (oven or double pots), it is broken down, unclean they [are], yea, unclean they are to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Only -- a fountain or pit, a collection of water, is clean, but that which is coming against their carcase is unclean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when [any] of their carcase falleth on any sown seed which is sown -- it [is] clean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when water is put on the seed, and [any] of its carcase hath fallen on it -- unclean it [is] to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when any of the beasts which are to you for food dieth, he who is coming against its carcase is unclean till the evening;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he who is eating of its carcase doth wash his garments, and hath been unclean till the evening; and he who is lifting up its carcase doth wash his garments, and hath been unclean till the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And every teeming thing which is teeming on the earth is an abomination, it is not eaten;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: any thing going on the belly, and any going on four, unto every multiplier of feet, to every teeming thing which is teeming on the earth -- ye do not eat them, for they [are] an abomination;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ye do not make yourselves abominable with any teeming thing which is teeming, nor do ye make yourselves unclean with them, so that ye have been unclean thereby.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `For I [am] Jehovah your God, and ye have sanctified yourselves, and ye have been holy, for I [am] holy; and ye do not defile your persons with any teeming thing which is creeping on the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I [am] Jehovah who am bringing you up out of the land of Egypt to become your God; and ye have been holy, for I [am] holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This [is] a law of the beasts, and of the fowl, and of every living creature which is moving in the waters, and of every creature which is teeming on the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to make separation between the unclean and the pure, and between the beast that is eaten, and the beast that is not eaten.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, saying, A woman when she giveth seed, and hath born a male, then she hath been unclean seven days, according to the days of separation for her sickness she is unclean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the eighth day is the flesh of his foreskin circumcised;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thirty and three days she doth abide in the blood of her cleansing; against any holy thing she doth not come, and unto the sanctuary she doth not go in, till the fulness of the days of her cleansing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if a female she bear, then she hath been unclean two weeks, as in her separation; and sixty and six days she doth abide for the blood of her cleansing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And in the fulness of the days of her cleansing for son or for daughter she doth bring in a lamb, a son of a year, for a burnt-offering, and a young pigeon or a turtle-dove for a sin-offering, unto the opening of the tent of meeting, unto the priest;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath brought it near before Jehovah, and hath made atonement for her, and she hath been cleansed from the fountain of her blood; this [is] the law of her who is bearing, in regard to a male or to a female.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if her hand find not the sufficiency of a sheep, then she hath taken two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, one for a burnt-offering, and one for a sin-offering, and the priest hath made atonement for her, and she hath been cleansed.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, and unto Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a man hath in the skin of his flesh a rising, or scab, or bright spot, and it hath become in the skin of his flesh a leprous plague, then he hath been brought in unto Aaron the priest, or unto one of his sons the priests;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath seen the plague in the skin of the flesh, and the hair in the plague hath turned white, and the appearance of the plague [is] deeper than the skin of his flesh -- it [is] a plague of leprosy, and the priest hath seen him, and hath pronounced him unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if the bright spot is white in the skin of his flesh, and its appearance is not deeper than the skin, and its hair hath not turned white, then hath the priest shut up [him who hath] the plague seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest hath seen him on the seventh day, and lo, the plague hath stood in his eyes, the plague hath not spread in the skin, and the priest hath shut him up a second seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest hath seen him on the second seventh day, and lo, the plague is become weak, and the plague hath not spread in the skin -- and the priest hath pronounced him clean, it [is] a scab, and he hath washed his garments, and hath been clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if the scab spread greatly in the skin, after his being seen by the priest for his cleansing, then he hath been seen a second time by the priest;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath seen, and lo, the scab hath spread in the skin, and the priest hath pronounced him unclean; it [is] leprosy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a plague of leprosy is in a man, then he hath been brought in unto the priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath seen, and lo, a white rising in the skin, and it hath turned the hair white, and a quickening of raw flesh [is] in the rising, --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: an old leprosy it [is] in the skin of his flesh, and the priest hath pronounced him unclean; he doth not shut him up, for he [is] unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if the leprosy break out greatly in the skin, and the leprosy hath covered all the skin of [him who hath] the plague, from his head even unto his feet, to all that appeareth to the eyes of the priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hath the priest seen, and lo, the leprosy hath covered all his flesh, and he hath pronounced [him who hath] the plague clean; it hath all turned white; he [is] clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And in the day of raw flesh being seen in him he is unclean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath seen the raw flesh, and hath pronounced him unclean; the raw flesh is unclean, it [is] leprosy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or when the raw flesh turneth back, and hath been turned to white, then he hath come in unto the priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath seen him, and lo, the plague hath been turned to white, and the priest hath pronounced clean [him who hath] the plague; he [is] clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when flesh hath in it, in its skin, an ulcer, and it hath been healed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there hath been in the place of the ulcer a white rising, or a bright white spot, very red, then it hath been seen by the priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath seen, and lo, its appearance [is] lower than the skin, and its hair hath turned white, and the priest hath pronounced him unclean; it [is] a plague of leprosy -- in an ulcer it hath broken out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if the priest see it, and lo, there is no white hair in it, and it is not lower than the skin, and is become weak, then hath the priest shut him up seven days;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if it spread greatly in the skin, then hath the priest pronounced him unclean, it [is] a plague;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if in its place the bright spot stay -- it hath not spread -- it [is] an inflammation of the ulcer; and the priest hath pronounced him clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Or when flesh hath in its skin a fiery burning, and the quickening of the burning, the bright white spot, hath been very red or white,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath seen it, and lo, the hair hath turned white in the bright spot, and its appearance [is] deeper than the skin; leprosy it [is], in the burning it hath broken out, and the priest hath pronounced him unclean; it [is] a plague of leprosy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if the priest see it, and lo, there is no white hair on the bright spot, and it is not lower than the skin, and it is become weak, then the priest hath shut him up seven days;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath seen him on the seventh day, if it spread greatly in the skin, then the priest hath pronounced him unclean; a plague of leprosy it [is].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if the bright spot stay in its place, it hath not spread in the skin, and is become weak; a rising of the burning it [is], and the priest hath pronounced him clean; for it [is] inflammation of the burning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man (or a woman) hath in him a plague in the head or in the beard,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hath the priest seen the plague, and lo, its appearance is deeper than the skin, and in it a thin shining hair, and the priest hath pronounced him unclean; it [is] a scall -- it [is] a leprosy of the head or of the beard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when the priest seeth the plague of the scall, and lo, its appearance is not deeper than the skin, and there is no black hair in it, then hath the priest shut up [him who hath] the plague of the scall seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest hath seen the plague on the seventh day, and lo, the scall hath not spread, and a shining hair hath not been in it, and the appearance of the scall is not deeper than the skin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he hath shaved himself, but the scall he doth not shave; and the priest hath shut up [him who hath] the scall a second seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest hath seen the scall on the seventh day, and lo, the scall hath not spread in the skin, and its appearance is not deeper than the skin, and the priest hath pronounced him clean, and he hath washed his garments, and hath been clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if the scall spread greatly in the skin after his cleansing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath seen him, and lo, the scall hath spread in the skin, the priest seeketh not for the shining hair, he is unclean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if in his eyes the scall hath stayed, and black hair hath sprung up in it, the scall hath been healed -- he [is] clean -- and the priest hath pronounced him clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man or woman hath in the skin of their flesh bright spots, white bright spots,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath seen, and lo, in the skin of their flesh white weak bright spots, it [is] a freckled spot broken out in the skin; he [is] clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man's head [is] polished, he [is] bald, he [is] clean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if from the corner of his face his head is polished, he [is] bald of the forehead; he [is] clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when there is in the bald back of the head, or in the bald forehead, a very red white plague, it [is] a leprosy breaking out in the bald back of the head, or in the bald forehead;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath seen him, and lo, the rising of the very red white plague in the bald back of the head, or in the bald forehead, [is] as the appearance of leprosy, in the skin of the flesh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he [is] a leprous man, he [is] unclean; the priest doth pronounce him utterly unclean; his plague [is] in his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `As to the leper in whom [is] the plague, his garments are rent, and his head is uncovered, and he covereth over the upper lip, and `Unclean! unclean!' he calleth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the days that the plague [is] in him he is unclean; he [is] unclean, alone he doth dwell, at the outside of the camp [is] his dwelling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when there is in any garment a plague of leprosy, -- in a garment of wool, or in a garment of linen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or in the warp, or in the woof, of linen or of wool, or in a skin, or in any work of skin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the plague hath been very green or very red in the garment, or in the skin, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in any vessel of skin, it [is] a plague of leprosy, and it hath been shewn the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest hath seen the plague, and hath shut up [that which hath] the plague, seven days;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath seen the plague on the seventh day, and the plague hath spread in the garment, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in the skin, of all that is made of skin for work; the plague [is] a fretting leprosy, it [is] unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he hath burnt the garment, or the warp, or the woof, in wool or in linen, or any vessel of skin in which the plague is; for it [is] a fretting leprosy; with fire it is burnt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if the priest see, and lo, the plague hath not spread in the garment, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in any vessel of skin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hath the priest commanded, and they have washed that in which the plague [is], and he hath shut it up a second seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest hath seen [that which hath] the plague after it hath been washed, and lo, the plague hath not changed its aspect, and the plague hath not spread, -- it [is] unclean; with fire thou dost burn it; it [is] a fretting in its back-part or in its front-part.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if the priest hath seen, and lo, the plague [is] become weak after it hath been washed, then he hath rent it out of the garment, or out of the skin, or out of the warp, or out of the woof;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if it still be seen in the garment, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in any vessel of skin, it [is] a fretting; with fire thou dost burn it -- that in which the plague [is].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the garment, or the warp, or the woof, or any vessel of skin which thou dost wash when the plague hath turned aside from them, then it hath been washed a second time, and hath been clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This [is] the law of a plague of leprosy [in] a garment of wool or of linen, or of the warp or of the woof, or of any vessel of skin, to pronounce it clean or to pronounce it unclean.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This is a law of the leper, in the day of his cleansing, that he hath been brought in unto the priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath gone out unto the outside of the camp, and the priest hath seen, and lo, the plague of leprosy hath ceased from the leper,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath commanded, and he hath taken for him who is to be cleansed, two clean living birds, and cedar wood, and scarlet, and hyssop.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest hath commanded, and he hath slaughtered the one bird upon an earthen vessel, over running water;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: [as to] the living bird, he taketh it, and the cedar wood, and the scarlet, and the hyssop, and hath dipped them and the living bird in the blood of the slaughtered bird, over the running water,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath sprinkled on him who is to be cleansed from the leprosy seven times, and hath pronounced him clean, and hath sent out the living bird on the face of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he who is to be cleansed hath washed his garments, and hath shaved all his hair, and hath bathed with water, and hath been clean, and afterwards he doth come in unto the camp, and hath dwelt at the outside of his tent seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been, on the seventh day -- he shaveth all his hair, his head, and his beard, and his eyebrows, even all his hair he doth shave, and he hath washed his garments, and hath bathed his flesh with water, and hath been clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And on the eighth day he taketh two lambs, perfect ones, and one ewe-lamb, daughter of a year, a perfect one, and three tenth deals of flour [for] a present, mixed with oil, and one log of oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest who is cleansing hath caused the man who is to be cleansed to stand with them before Jehovah, at the opening of the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath taken the one he-lamb, and hath brought it near for a guilt-offering, also the log of oil, and hath waved them -- a wave offering before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he hath slaughtered the lamb in the place where he slaughtereth the sin-offering and the burnt-offering, in the holy place; for like the sin-offering the guilt-offering is to the priest; it [is] most holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest hath taken of the blood of the guilt-offering, and the priest hath put on the tip of the right ear of him who is to be cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the great toe of his right foot;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath taken of the log of oil, and hath poured on the left palm of the priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath dipped his right finger in the oil which [is] on his left palm, and hath sprinkled of the oil with his finger seven times before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And of the residue of the oil which [is] on his palm, the priest putteth on the tip of the right ear of him who is to be cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the great toe of his right foot, on the blood of the guilt-offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the remnant of the oil which [is] on the palm of the priest, he putteth on the head of him who is to be cleansed, and the priest hath made atonement for him before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest hath made the sin-offering, and hath made atonement for him who is to be cleansed from his uncleanness, and afterwards he doth slaughter the burnt-offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath caused the burnt-offering to ascend, also the present, on the altar, and the priest hath made atonement for him, and he hath been clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if he [is] poor, and his hand is not reaching [these things], then he hath taken one lamb -- a guilt-offering, for a wave-offering, to make atonement for him, and one-tenth deal of flour mixed with oil for a present, and a log of oil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, which his hand reacheth to, and one hath been a sin-offering, and the one a burnt-offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath brought them in on the eighth day for his cleansing unto the priest, unto the opening of the tent of meeting, before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest hath taken the lamb of the guilt-offering, and the log of oil, and the priest hath waved them -- a wave-offering before Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath slaughtered the lamb of the guilt-offering, and the priest hath taken of the blood of the guilt-offering, and hath put on the tip of the right ear of him who is to be cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the great toe of his right foot;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest doth pour of the oil on the left palm of the priest;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath sprinkled with his right finger of the oil which [is] on his left palm, seven times before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest hath put of the oil which [is] on his palm, on the tip of the right ear of him who is to be cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the great toe of his right foot, on the place of the blood of the guilt-offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the remnant of the oil which [is] on the palm of the priest he doth put on the head of him who is to be cleansed, to make atonement for him, before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he hath made the one of the turtle-doves, or of the young pigeons (from that which his hand reacheth to,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: [even] that which his hand reacheth to), the one a sin-offering, and the one a burnt offering, besides the present, and the priest hath made atonement for him who is to be cleansed before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This [is] a law of him in whom [is] a plague of leprosy, whose hand reacheth not to his cleansing.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, and unto Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When ye come in unto the land of Canaan, which I am giving to you for a possession, and I have put a plague of leprosy in a house [in] the land of your possession;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hath he whose the house [is] come in and declared to the priest, saying, As a plague hath appeared to me in the house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath commanded, and they have prepared the house before the priest cometh in to see the plague (that all which [is] in the house be not unclean), and afterwards doth the priest come in to see the house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath seen the plague, and lo, the plague [is] in the walls of the house, hollow strakes, very green or very red, and their appearance [is] lower than the wall,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath gone out of the house unto the opening of the house, and hath shut up the house seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest hath turned back on the seventh day, and hath seen, and lo, the plague hath spread in the walls of the house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath commanded, and they have drawn out the stones in which the plague [is], and have cast them unto the outside of the city, unto an unclean place;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the house he doth cause to be scraped within round about, and they have poured out the clay which they have scraped off, at the outside of the city, at an unclean place;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they have taken other stones, and brought [them] in unto the place of the stones, and other clay he taketh and hath daubed the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if the plague return, and hath broken out in the house, after he hath drawn out the stones, and after the scraping of the house, and after the daubing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hath the priest come in and seen, and lo, the plague hath spread in the house; it [is] a fretting leprosy in the house; it [is] unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he hath broken down the house, its stones, and its wood, and all the clay of the house, and he hath brought [them] forth unto the outside of the city, unto an unclean place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he who is going in unto the house all the days he hath shut it up, is unclean till the evening;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he who is lying in the house doth wash his garments; and he who is eating in the house doth wash his garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator
