verses.text: `And if the priest certainly come in, and hath seen, and lo, the plague hath not spread in the house after the daubing of the house, then hath the priest pronounced the house clean, for the plague hath been healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he hath taken for the cleansing of the house two birds, and cedar wood, and scarlet, and hyssop;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath slaughtered the one bird upon an earthen vessel, over running water;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath taken the cedar wood, and the hyssop, and the scarlet, and the living bird, and hath dipped them in the blood of the slaughtered bird, and in the running water, and hath sprinkled upon the house seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he hath cleansed the house with the blood of the bird, and with the running water, and with the living bird, and with the cedar wood, and with the hyssop, and with the scarlet;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath sent away the living bird unto the outside of the city unto the face of the field, and hath made atonement for the house, and it hath been clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This [is] the law for every plague of the leprosy and for scall,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for leprosy of a garment, and of a house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for a rising, and for a scab, and for a bright spot, --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to direct in the day of being unclean, and in the day of being clean; this [is] the law of the leprosy.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, and unto Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, and ye have said unto them, When there is an issue out of the flesh of any man, [for] his issue he [is] unclean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and this is his uncleanness in his issue -- his flesh hath run with his issue, or his flesh hath stopped from his issue; it [is] his uncleanness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `All the bed on which he lieth who hath the issue is unclean, and all the vessel on which he sitteth is unclean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and any one who cometh against his bed doth wash his garments, and hath bathed with water, and been unclean till the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he who is sitting on the vessel on which he sitteth who hath the issue, doth wash his garments, and hath bathed with water, and been unclean till the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he who is coming against the flesh of him who hath the issue, doth wash his garments, and hath bathed with water, and hath been unclean till the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when he who hath the issue spitteth on him who is clean, then he hath washed his garments, and hath bathed with water, and been unclean till the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And all the saddle on which he rideth who hath the issue is unclean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and any one who is coming against anything which is under him is unclean till the evening, and he who is bearing them doth wash his garments, and hath bathed with water, and been unclean till the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And anyone against whom he cometh who hath the issue (and his hands hath not rinsed with water) hath even washed his garments, and bathed with water, and been unclean till the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the earthen vessel which he who hath the issue cometh against is broken; and every wooden vessel is rinsed with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when he who hath the issue is clean from his issue, then he hath numbered to himself seven days for his cleansing, and hath washed his garments, and hath bathed his flesh with running water, and been clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And on the eighth day he taketh to himself two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, and hath come in before Jehovah unto the opening of the tent of meeting, and hath given them unto the priest;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath made them, one a sin-offering, and the one a burnt-offering; and the priest hath made atonement for him before Jehovah, because of his issue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man's seed of copulation goeth out from him, then he hath bathed with water all his flesh, and been unclean till the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And any garment, or any skin on which there is seed of copulation, hath also been washed with water, and been unclean till the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a woman with whom a man lieth with seed of copulation, they also have bathed with water, and been unclean till the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a woman hath an issue -- blood is her issue in her flesh -- seven days she is in her separation, and any one who is coming against her is unclean till the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And anything on which she lieth in her separation is unclean, and anything on which she sitteth is unclean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and any one who is coming against her bed doth wash his garments, and hath bathed with water, and been unclean till the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And any one who is coming against any vessel on which she sitteth doth wash his garments, and hath washed with water, and been unclean till the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if it [is] on the bed, or on the vessel on which she is sitting, in his coming against it, he is unclean till the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if a man really lie with her, and her separation is on him, then he hath been unclean seven days, and all the bed on which he lieth is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a woman's issue of blood floweth many days within the time of her separation, or when it floweth over her separation -- all the days of the issue of her uncleanness are as the days of her separation; she [is] unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `All the bed on which she lieth all the days of her issue is as the bed of her separation to her, and all the vessel on which she sitteth is unclean as the uncleanness of her separation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and any one who is coming against them is unclean, and hath washed his garments, and hath bathed with water, and been unclean till the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if she hath been clean from her issue, then she hath numbered to herself seven days, and afterwards she is clean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the eighth day she taketh to herself two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, and hath brought them in unto the priest, unto the opening of the tent of meeting;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath made the one a sin-offering, and the one a burnt-offering, and the priest hath made atonement for her before Jehovah, because of the issue of her uncleanness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye have separated the sons of Israel from their uncleanness, and they die not in their uncleanness, in their defiling My tabernacle which [is] in their midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This [is] the law of him who hath an issue, and of him whose seed of copulation goeth out from him, for uncleanness thereby,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of her who is sick in her separation, and of him who hath an issue, the issue of a male or of a female, and of a man who lieth with an unclean woman.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, after the death of the two sons of Aaron, in their drawing near before Jehovah, and they die;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yea, Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Speak unto Aaron thy brother, and he cometh not in at all times unto the sanctuary within the vail, unto the front of the mercy-seat, which [is] upon the ark, and he dieth not, for in a cloud I am seen upon the mercy-seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `With this doth Aaron come in unto the sanctuary; with a bullock, a son of the herd, for a sin-offering, and a ram for a burnt-offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a holy linen coat he putteth on, and linen trousers are on his flesh, and with a linen girdle he girdeth himself, and with a linen mitre he wrappeth himself up; they [are] holy garments; and he hath bathed with water his flesh, and hath put them on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And from the company of the sons of Israel he taketh two kids of the goats for a sin-offering, and one ram for a burnt-offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aaron hath brought near the bullock of the sin-offering which is his own, and hath made atonement for himself, and for his house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath taken the two goats, and hath caused them to stand before Jehovah, at the opening of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And Aaron hath given lots over the two goats, one lot for Jehovah, and one lot for a goat of departure;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aaron hath brought near the goat on which the lot for Jehovah hath gone up, and hath made it a sin-offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the goat on which the lot for a goat of departure hath gone up is caused to stand living before Jehovah to make atonement by it, to send it away for a goat of departure into the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And Aaron hath brought near the bullock of the sin-offering which is his own, and hath made atonement for himself, and for his house, and hath slaughtered the bullock of the sin-offering which [is] his own,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hath taken the fulness of the censer of burning coals of fire from off the altar, from before Jehovah, and the fulness of his hands of thin spice-perfume, and hath brought [it] within the vail;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath put the perfume on the fire before Jehovah, and the cloud of the perfume hath covered the mercy-seat which [is] on the testimony, and he dieth not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he hath taken of the blood of the bullock, and hath sprinkled with his finger on the front of the mercy-seat eastward; even at the front of the mercy-seat he doth sprinkle seven times of the blood with his finger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he hath slaughtered the goat of the sin-offering which [is] the people's, and hath brought in its blood unto the inside of the vail, and hath done with its blood as he hath done with the blood of the bullock, and hath sprinkled it on the mercy-seat, and at the front of the mercy-seat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath made atonement for the sanctuary because of the uncleanness of the sons of Israel, and because of their transgressions in all their sins; and so he doth for the tent of meeting which is tabernacling with them in the midst of their uncleannesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And no man is in the tent of meeting in his going in to make atonement in the sanctuary, till his coming out; and he hath made atonement for himself, and for his house, and for all the assembly of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he hath gone out unto the altar which [is] before Jehovah, and hath made atonement for it; and he hath taken of the blood of the bullock, and of the blood of the goat, and hath put on the horns of the altar round about;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath sprinkled on it of the blood with his finger seven times, and hath cleansed it, and hath hallowed it from the uncleannesses of the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he hath ceased from making atonement [for] the sanctuary, and the tent of meeting, and the altar, and hath brought near the living goat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aaron hath laid his two hands on the head of the living goat, and hath confessed over it all the iniquities of the sons of Israel, and all their transgressions in all their sins, and hath put them on the head of the goat, and hath sent [it] away by the hand of a fit man into the wilderness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the goat hath borne on him all their iniquities unto a land of separation. `And he hath sent the goat away into the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aaron hath come in unto the tent of meeting, and hath stripped off the linen garments which he had put on in his going in unto the sanctuary, and hath placed them there;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath bathed his flesh with water in the holy place, and hath put on his garments, and hath come out, and hath made his burnt-offering, and the burnt-offering of the people, and hath made atonement for himself and for the people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with the fat of the sin-offering he doth make perfume on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he who is sending away the goat for a goat of departure doth wash his garments, and hath bathed his flesh with water, and afterwards he cometh in unto the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the bullock of the sin-offering, and the goat of the sin-offering, whose blood hath been brought in to make atonement in the sanctuary, doth [one] bring out unto the outside of the camp, and they have burnt with fire their skins, and their flesh, and their dung;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he who is burning them doth wash his garments, and hath bathed his flesh with water, and afterwards he cometh in unto the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been to you for a statute age-during, in the seventh month, in the tenth of the month, ye humble yourselves, and do no work -- the native, and the sojourner who is sojourning in your midst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for on this day he maketh atonement for you, to cleanse you; from all your sins before Jehovah ye are clean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it [is] to you a sabbath of rest, and ye have humbled yourselves -- a statute age-during.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest whom he doth anoint, and whose hand he doth consecrate to act as priest instead of his father, hath made atonement, and hath put on the linen garments, the holy garments;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath made atonement [for] the holy sanctuary; and [for] the tent of meeting, even [for] the altar he doth make atonement; yea, for the priests, and for all the people of the assembly he maketh atonement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And this hath been to you for a statute age-during, to make atonement for the sons of Israel, because of all their sins, once in a year;' and he doth as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto Aaron, and unto his sons, and unto all the sons of Israel; and thou hast said unto them, This [is] the thing which Jehovah hath commanded, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any man of the house of Israel who slaughtereth ox, or lamb, or goat, in the camp, or who slaughtereth at the outside of the camp,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and unto the opening of the tent of meeting hath not brought it in to bring near an offering to Jehovah before the tabernacle of Jehovah, blood is reckoned to that man -- blood he hath shed -- and that man hath been cut off from the midst of his people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the sons of Israel do bring in their sacrifices which they are sacrificing on the face of the field, yea, they have brought them in to Jehovah, unto the opening of the tent of meeting, unto the priest, and they have sacrificed sacrifices of peace-offerings to Jehovah with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priest hath sprinkled the blood upon the altar of Jehovah, at the opening of the tent of meeting, and hath made perfume with the fat for sweet fragrance to Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they sacrifice not any more their sacrifices to goats after which they are going a-whoring; a statute age-during is this to them, to their generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And unto them thou sayest: Any man of the house of Israel, or of the sojourners, who sojourneth in your midst, who causeth burnt-offering or sacrifice to ascend,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and unto the opening of the tent of meeting doth not bring it in to make it to Jehovah -- that man hath been cut off from his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And any man of the house of Israel, or of the sojourners, who is sojourning in your midst, who eateth any blood, I have even set My face against the person who is eating the blood, and have cut him off from the midst of his people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the life of the flesh is in the blood, and I have given it to you on the altar, to make atonement for your souls; for it [is] the blood which maketh atonement for the soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Therefore I have said to the sons of Israel, No person among you doth eat blood, and the sojourner who is sojourning in your midst doth not eat blood;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and any man of the sons of Israel, or of the sojourners, who is sojourning in your midst, who hunteth venison, beast or fowl, which is eaten -- hath even poured out its blood, and hath covered it with dust;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for [it is] the life of all flesh, its blood is for its life; and I say to the sons of Israel, Blood of any flesh ye do not eat, for the life of all flesh is its blood; any one eating it is cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And any person who eateth a carcase or torn thing, among natives or among sojourners -- hath both washed his garments, and hath bathed with water, and hath been unclean until the evening -- then he hath been clean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if he wash not, and his flesh bathe not -- then he hath borne his iniquity.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, and thou hast said unto them, I [am] Jehovah your God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: according to the work of the land of Egypt in which ye have dwelt ye do not, and according to the work of the land of Canaan whither I am bringing you in, ye do not, and in their statutes ye walk not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `My judgments ye do, and My statutes ye keep, to walk in them; I [am] Jehovah your God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have kept My statutes and My judgments which man doth and liveth in them; I [am] Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `None of you unto any relation of his flesh doth draw near to uncover nakedness; I [am] Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The nakedness of thy father and the nakedness of thy mother thou dost not uncover, she [is] thy mother; thou dost not uncover her nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The nakedness of the wife of thy father thou dost not uncover; it [is] the nakedness of thy father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The nakedness of thy sister, daughter of thy father, or daughter of thy mother, born at home or born without; thou dost not uncover their nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The nakedness of thy son's daughter, or of thy daughter's daughter: thou dost not uncover their nakedness; for theirs [is] thy nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The nakedness of a daughter of thy father's wife, begotten of thy father, she [is] thy sister; thou dost not uncover her nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The nakedness of a sister of thy father thou dost not uncover; she [is] a relation of thy father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The nakedness of thy mother's sister thou dost not uncover; for she [is] thy mother's relation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The nakedness of thy father's brother thou dost not uncover; unto his wife thou dost not draw near; she [is] thine aunt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The nakedness of thy daughter-in-law thou dost not uncover; she [is] thy son's wife; thou dost not uncover her nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The nakedness of thy brother's wife thou dost not uncover; it [is] thy brother's nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The nakedness of a woman and her daughter thou dost not uncover; her son's daughter, and her daughter's daughter thou dost not take to uncover her nakedness; they [are] her relations; it [is] wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a woman unto another thou dost not take, to be an adversary, to uncover her nakedness beside her, in her life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And unto a woman in the separation of her uncleanness thou dost not draw near to uncover her nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And unto the wife of thy fellow thou dost not give thy seed of copulation, for uncleanness with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And of thy seed thou dost not give to pass over to the Molech; nor dost thou pollute the name of thy God; I [am] Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And with a male thou dost not lie as one lieth with a woman; abomination it [is].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And with any beast thou dost not give thy copulation, for uncleanness with it; and a woman doth not stand before a beast to lie down with it; confusion it [is].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Ye are not defiled with all these, for with all these have the nations been defiled which I am sending away from before you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the land is defiled, and I charge its iniquity upon it, and the land vomiteth out its inhabitants:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye -- ye have kept My statutes and My judgments, and do not [any] of all these abominations, the native and the sojourner who is sojourning in your midst,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for all these abominations have the men of the land done who [are] before you, and the land is defiled),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the land doth not vomit you out in your defiling it, as it hath vomited out the nation which [is] before you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for any one who doth [any] of all these abominations -- even the persons who are doing [so], have been cut off from the midst of their people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have kept My charge, so as not to do [any] of the abominable statutes which have been done before you, and ye do not defile yourselves with them; I [am] Jehovah your God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto all the company of the sons of Israel, and thou hast said unto them, Ye are holy, for holy [am] I, Jehovah, your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Each his mother and his father ye do fear, and My sabbaths ye do keep; I [am] Jehovah your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Ye do not turn unto the idols, and a molten god ye do not make to yourselves; I [am] Jehovah your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when ye sacrifice a sacrifice of peace-offerings to Jehovah, at your pleasure ye do sacrifice it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the day of your sacrificing it is eaten, and on the morrow, and that which is left unto the third day with fire is burnt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if it be really eaten on the third day, it [is] an abomination, it is not pleasing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he who is eating it his iniquity doth bear, for the holy thing of Jehovah he hath polluted, and that person hath been cut off from his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And in your reaping the harvest of your land ye do not completely reap the corner of thy field, and the gleaning of thy harvest thou dost not gather,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thy vineyard thou dost not glean, even the omitted part of thy vineyard thou dost not gather, to the poor and to the sojourner thou dost leave them; I [am] Jehovah your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Ye do not steal, nor feign, nor lie one against his fellow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye do not swear by My name to falsehood, or thou hast polluted the name of thy God; I [am] Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not oppress thy neighbour, nor take plunder; the wages of the hireling doth not remain with thee till morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not revile the deaf; and before the blind thou dost not put a stumbling block; and thou hast been afraid of thy God; I [am] Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Ye do not do perversity in judgment; thou dost not lift up the face of the poor, nor honour the face of the great; in righteousness thou dost judge thy fellow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not go slandering among thy people; thou dost not stand against the blood of thy neighbour; I [am] Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not hate thy brother in thy heart; thou dost certainly reprove thy fellow, and not suffer sin on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not take vengeance, nor watch the sons of thy people; and thou hast had love to thy neighbour as thyself; I [am] Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `My statutes ye do keep: thy cattle thou dost not cause to gender [with] diverse kinds; thy field thou dost not sow with diverse kinds, and a garment of diverse kinds, shaatnez, doth not go up upon thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man lieth with a woman with seed of copulation, and she a maid-servant, betrothed to a man, and not really ransomed, or freedom hath not been given to her, an investigation there is; they are not put to death, for she [is] not free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he hath brought in his guilt-offering to Jehovah, unto the opening of the tent of meeting, a ram [for] a guilt-offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath made atonement for him with the ram of the guilt-offering before Jehovah, for his sin which he hath sinned, and it hath been forgiven him because of his sin which he hath sinned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when ye come in unto the land, and have planted all [kinds] of trees [for] food, then ye have reckoned as uncircumcised its fruit, three years it is to you uncircumcised, it is not eaten,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the fourth year all its fruit is holy -- praises for Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the fifth year ye do eat its fruit -- to add to you its increase; I [am] Jehovah your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Ye do not eat with the blood; ye do not enchant, nor observe clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Ye do not round the corner of your head, nor destroy the corner of thy beard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a cutting for the soul ye do not put in your flesh; and a writing, a cross-mark, ye do not put on you; I [am] Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not pollute thy daughter to cause her to go a-whoring, that the land go not a-whoring, and the land hath been full of wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `My sabbaths ye do keep, and My sanctuary ye do reverence; I [am] Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Ye do not turn unto those having familiar spirits; and unto wizards ye do not seek, for uncleanness by them; I [am] Jehovah your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `At the presence of grey hairs thou dost rise up, and thou hast honoured the presence of an old man, and hast been afraid of thy God; I [am] Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a sojourner sojourneth with thee in your land, thou dost not oppress him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as a native among you is the sojourner to you who is sojourning with you, and thou hast had love to him as to thyself, for sojourners ye have been in the land of Egypt; I [am] Jehovah your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Ye do not do perversity in judgment, in mete-yard, in weight, or in liquid measure;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: righteous balances, righteous weights, a righteous ephah, and a righteous hin ye have; I [am] Jehovah your God, who hath brought you out from the land of Egypt;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have observed all my statutes, and all my judgments, and have done them; I [am] Jehovah.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And unto the sons of Israel thou dost say, Any man of the sons of Israel, and of the sojourners who is sojourning in Israel, who giveth of his seed to the Molech, is certainly put to death; the people of the land do stone him with stones;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I -- I set My face against that man, and have cut him off from the midst of his people, for of his seed he hath given to the Molech, so as to defile My sanctuary, and to pollute My holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if the people of the land really hide their eyes from that man, in his giving of his seed to the Molech, so as not to put him to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I have set My face against that man, and against his family, and have cut him off, and all who are going a-whoring after him, even going a-whoring after the Molech, from the midst of their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the person who turneth unto those having familiar spirits, and unto the wizards, to go a-whoring after them, I have even set My face against that person, and cut him off from the midst of his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye have sanctified yourselves, and ye have been holy, for I [am] Jehovah your God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have kept My statutes and have done them; I [am] Jehovah, sanctifying you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `For any man who revileth his father and his mother is certainly put to death; his father and his mother he hath reviled: his blood [is] on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a man who committeth adultery with a man's wife -- who committeth adultery with the wife of his neighbour -- the adulterer and the adulteress are surely put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a man who lieth with his father's wife -- the nakedness of his father he hath uncovered -- both of them are certainly put to death; their blood [is] on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a man who lieth with his daughter-in-law -- both of them are certainly put to death; confusion they have made; their blood [is] on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a man who lieth with a male as one lieth with a woman; abomination both of them have done; they are certainly put to death; their blood [is] on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a man who taketh the woman and her mother -- it [is] wickedness; with fire they burn him and them, and there is no wickedness in your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a man who giveth his lying with a beast is certainly put to death, and the beast ye do slay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a woman who draweth near unto any beast to lie with it -- thou hast even slain the woman and the beast; they are certainly put to death; their blood [is] on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a man who taketh his sister, a daughter of his father or daughter of his mother, and he hath seen her nakedness, and she seeth his nakedness: it is a shame; and they have been cut off before the eyes of the sons of their people; the nakedness of his sister he hath uncovered; his iniquity he beareth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a man who lieth with a sick woman, and hath uncovered her nakedness, her fountain he hath made bare, and she hath uncovered the fountain of her blood, -- even both of them have been cut off from the midst of their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the nakedness of thy mother's sister, and of thy father's sister, thou dost not uncover; because his relation he hath made bare; their iniquity they bear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a man who lieth with his aunt, the nakedness of his uncle he hath uncovered; their sin they bear; childless they die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a man who taketh his brother's wife -- it [is] impurity; the nakedness of his brother he hath uncovered; childless they are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye have kept all My statutes, and all My judgments, and have done them, and the land vomiteth you not out whither I am bringing you in to dwell in it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye walk not in the statutes of the nation which I am sending away from before you, for all these they have done, and I am wearied with them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I say to you, Ye -- ye do possess their ground, and I -- I give it to you to possess it, a land flowing with milk and honey; I [am] Jehovah your God, who hath separated you from the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye have made separation between the pure beasts and the unclean, and between the unclean fowl and the pure, and ye do not make yourselves abominable by beast or by fowl, or by anything which creepeth [on] the ground which I have separated to you for unclean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have been holy to Me; for holy [am] I, Jehovah; and I separate you from the peoples to become Mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a man or woman -- when there is in them a familiar spirit, or who [are] wizards -- are certainly put to death; with stones they stone them; their blood [is] on them.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Speak unto the priests, sons of Aaron, and thou hast said unto them, For [any] person [a priest] is not defiled among his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: except for his relation who [is] near unto him -- for his mother, and for his father, and for his son, and for his daughter, and for his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for his sister, the virgin, who is near unto him, who hath not been to a man; for her he is defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `A master [priest] doth not defile himself among his people -- to pollute himself;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they do not make baldness on their head, and the corner of their beard they do not shave, and in their flesh they do not make a cutting;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they are holy to their God, and they pollute not the name of their God, for the fire-offerings of Jehovah, bread of their God, they are bringing near, and have been holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `A woman, a harlot, or polluted, they do not take, and a woman cast out from her husband they do not take, for he [is] holy to his God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast sanctified him, for the bread of thy God he is bringing near; he is holy to thee; for holy [am] I, Jehovah, sanctifying you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a daughter of any priest when she polluteth herself by going a-whoring -- her father she is polluting; with fire she is burnt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the high priest of his brethren, on whose head is poured the anointing oil, and hath consecrated his hand to put on the garments, his head doth not uncover, nor rend his garments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor beside any dead person doth he come; for his father and for his mother he doth not defile himself;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor from the sanctuary doth he go out, nor doth he pollute the sanctuary of his God, for the separation of the anointing oil of his God [is] on him; I [am] Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he taketh a wife in her virginity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: widow, or cast out, or polluted one -- a harlot -- these he doth not take, but a virgin of his own people he doth take [for] a wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he doth not pollute his seed among his people; for I [am] Jehovah, sanctifying him.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto Aaron, saying, No man of thy seed to their generations in whom there is blemish doth draw near to bring near the bread of his God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for no man in whom [is] blemish doth draw near -- a man blind, or lame or dwarfed, or enlarged,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or a man in whom there is a breach in the foot, or a breach in the hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or hump-backed, or a dwarf, or with a mixture in his eye, or a scurvy person, or scabbed, or broken-testicled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `No man in whom is blemish (of the seed of Aaron the priest) doth come nigh to bring near the fire-offerings of Jehovah; blemish [is] in him; the bread of his God he doth not come nigh to bring near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Bread of his God -- of the most holy things, and of the holy things -- he doth eat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: only, unto the vail he doth not enter, and unto the altar he doth not draw nigh; for blemish [is] in him; and he doth not pollute My sanctuaries; for I [am] Jehovah, sanctifying them.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses speaketh unto Aaron, and unto his sons, and unto all the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto Aaron, and unto his sons, and they are separated from the holy things of the sons of Israel, and they pollute not My holy name in what they are hallowing to Me; I [am] Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Say unto them, To your generations, any man who draweth near, out of all your seed, unto the holy things which the sons of Israel do sanctify to Jehovah, and his uncleanness on him -- even that person hath been cut off from before Me; I [am] Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Any man of the seed of Aaron, and is leprous or hath an issue -- of the holy things he doth not eat till that he is clean; and he who is coming against any uncleanness of a person, or a man whose seed of copulation goeth out from him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or a man who cometh against any teeming thing which is unclean to him, or against a man who is unclean to him, even any of his uncleanness --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the person who cometh against it -- hath even been unclean till the evening, and doth not eat of the holy things, but hath bathed his flesh with water,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sun hath gone in, and he hath been clean, and afterwards he doth eat of the holy things, for it [is] his food;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a carcase or torn thing he doth not eat, for uncleanness thereby; I [am] Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And they have kept My charge, and bear no sin for it, that they have died for it when they pollute it; I [am] Jehovah sanctifying them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And no stranger doth eat of the holy thing; a settler of a priest and an hireling doth not eat of the holy thing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when a priest buyeth a person, the purchase of his money, he doth eat of it, also one born in his house; they do eat of his bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a priest's daughter, when she is a strange man's, -- she, of the heave-offering of the holy things doth not eat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a priest's daughter, when she is a widow, or cast out, and hath no seed, and hath turned back unto the house of her father, as [in] her youth, of her father's bread she doth eat; but no stranger doth eat of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man doth eat of a holy thing through ignorance, then he hath added its fifth part to it, and hath given [it] to the priest, with the holy thing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they do not pollute the holy things of the sons of Israel -- that which they lift up to Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor have caused them to bear the iniquity of the guilt-offering in their eating their holy things; for I [am] Jehovah, sanctifying them.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto Aaron, and unto his sons, and unto all the sons of Israel, and thou hast said unto them, Any man of the house of Israel, or of the sojourners in Israel, who bringeth near his offering, of all his vows, or of all his willing offerings which they bring near to Jehovah for a burnt-offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at your pleasure a perfect one, a male of the herd, of the sheep or of the goats;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nothing in which [is] blemish do ye bring near, for it is not for a pleasing thing for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man bringeth near a sacrifice of peace-offerings to Jehovah, to complete a vow, or for a willing-offering, of the herd or of the flock, it is perfect for a pleasing thing: no blemish is in it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: blind, or broken, or maimed, or having a wen, or scurvy, or scabbed -- ye do not bring these near to Jehovah, and a fire-offering ye do not make of them on the altar to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `As to an ox or a sheep enlarged or dwarfed -- a willing-offering ye do make it, but for a vow it is not pleasing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As to a bruised, or beaten, or enlarged, or cut thing -- ye do not bring [it] near to Jehovah; even in your land ye do not do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from the hand of a son of a stranger ye do not bring near the bread of your God, of any of these, for their corruption [is] in them; blemish [is] in them; they are not pleasing for you.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When ox or lamb or goat is born, and it hath been seven days under its dam, then from the eighth day and henceforth, it is pleasing for an offering, a fire-offering to Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but an ox or sheep -- it and its young one, ye do not slaughter in one day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when ye sacrifice a sacrifice of thanksgiving to Jehovah, at your pleasure ye do sacrifice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on that day it is eaten, ye do not leave of it till morning; I [am] Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have kept my commands, and have done them; I [am] Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye do not pollute My holy name, and I have been hallowed in the midst of the sons of Israel; I [am] Jehovah, sanctifying you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who am bringing you up out of the land of Egypt, to become your God; I [am] Jehovah.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, and thou hast said unto them, Appointed seasons of Jehovah, which ye proclaim, holy convocations, [are] these: they [are] My appointed seasons:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: six days is work done, and in the seventh day [is] a sabbath of rest, a holy convocation; ye do no work; it [is] a sabbath to Jehovah in all your dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `These [are] appointed seasons of Jehovah, holy convocations, which ye proclaim in their appointed seasons:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the first month, on the fourteenth of the month, between the evenings, [is] the passover to Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the fifteenth day of this month [is] the feast of unleavened things to Jehovah; seven days unleavened things ye do eat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on the first day ye have a holy convocation, ye do no servile work;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have brought near a fire-offering to Jehovah seven days; in the seventh day [is] a holy convocation; ye do no servile work.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, and thou hast said unto them, When ye come in unto the land which I am giving to you, and have reaped its harvest, and have brought in the sheaf, the beginning of your harvest unto the priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he hath waved the sheaf before Jehovah for your acceptance; on the morrow of the sabbath doth the priest wave it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye have prepared in the day of your waving the sheaf a lamb, a perfect one, a son of a year, for a burnt-offering to Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and its present two tenth deals of flour mixed with oil, a fire-offering to Jehovah, a sweet fragrance, and its drink-offering, wine, a fourth of the hin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And bread and roasted corn and full ears ye do not eat until this self-same day, until your bringing in the offering of your God -- a statute age-during to your generations, in all your dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye have numbered to you from the morrow of the sabbath, from the day of your bringing in the sheaf of the wave-offering: they are seven perfect sabbaths;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unto the morrow of the seventh sabbath ye do number fifty days, and ye have brought near a new present to Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: out of your dwellings ye bring in bread of a wave-offering, two [loaves], of two tenth deals of flour they are, [with] yeast they are baken, first-[fruits] to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye have brought near, besides the bread, seven lambs, perfect ones, sons of a year, and one bullock, a son of the herd, and two rams; they are a burnt-offering to Jehovah, with their present and their libations, a fire-offering of sweet fragrance to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye have prepared one kid of the goats for a sin-offering, and two lambs, sons of a year, for a sacrifice of peace-offerings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath waved them, besides the bread of the first-[fruits] -- a wave-offering before Jehovah, besides the two lambs; they are holy to Jehovah for the priest;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have proclaimed on this self-same day: a holy convocation is to you, ye do no servile work -- a statute age-during in all your dwellings, to your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And in your reaping the harvest of your land thou dost not complete the corner of thy field in thy reaping, and the gleaning of thy harvest thou dost not gather, to the poor and to the sojourner thou dost leave them; I Jehovah [am] your God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, saying, In the seventh month, on the first of the month, ye have a sabbath, a memorial of shouting, a holy convocation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ye do no servile work, and ye have brought near a fire-offering to Jehovah.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Only -- on the tenth of this seventh month is a day of atonements; ye have a holy convocation, and ye have humbled yourselves, and have brought near a fire-offering to Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye do no work in this self-same day, for it is a day of atonements, to make atonement for you, before Jehovah your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `For any person who is not humbled in this self-same day hath even been cut off from his people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and any person who doth any work in this self-same day I have even destroyed that person from the midst of his people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ye do no work -- a statute age-during to your generations in all your dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It [is] a sabbath of rest to you, and ye have humbled yourselves in the ninth of the month at even; from evening till evening ye do keep your sabbath.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, saying, In the fifteenth day of this seventh month [is] a feast of booths seven days to Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on the first day [is] a holy convocation, ye do no servile work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: seven days ye bring near a fire-offering to Jehovah, on the eighth day ye have a holy convocation, and ye have brought near a fire-offering to Jehovah; it [is] a restraint, ye do no servile work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `These [are] appointed seasons of Jehovah, which ye proclaim holy convocations, to bring near a fire-offering to Jehovah, a burnt-offering, and a present, a sacrifice, and libations, a thing of a day in its day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: apart from the sabbaths of Jehovah, and apart from your gifts, and apart from all your vows, and apart from all your willing-offerings, which ye give to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Only -- in the fifteenth day of the seventh month, in your gathering the increase of the land, ye do keep the feast of Jehovah seven days; on the first day [is] a sabbath, and on the eighth day a sabbath;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have taken to yourselves on the first day the fruit of beautiful trees, branches of palms, and boughs of thick trees, and willows of a brook, and have rejoiced before Jehovah your God seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye have kept it a feast to Jehovah, seven days in a year -- a statute age-during to your generations; in the seventh month ye keep it a feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `In booths ye dwell seven days; all who are natives in Israel dwell in booths,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that your generations do know that in booths I caused the sons of Israel to dwell; in my bringing them out of the land of Egypt; I, Jehovah, [am] your God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses speaketh [concerning] the appointed seasons of Jehovah unto the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Command the sons of Israel, and they bring unto thee pure olive oil, beaten, for the lamp, to cause a light to go up continually;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the outside of the vail of the testimony in the tent of meeting doth Aaron arrange it from evening till morning before Jehovah continually -- a statute age-during to your generations;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by the pure candlestick he doth arrange the lights before Jehovah continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast taken flour, and hast baked twelve cakes with it, two tenth deals are in the one cake,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast set them two ranks (six in the rank) on the pure table before Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast put on the rank pure frankincense, and it hath been to the bread for a memorial, a fire-offering to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `On each sabbath-day he arrangeth it before Jehovah continually, from the sons of Israel -- a covenant age-during;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been to Aaron, and to his sons, and they have eaten it in the holy place, for it [is] most holy to him, from the fire-offerings of Jehovah -- a statute age-during.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a son of an Israelitish woman goeth out (and he [is] son of an Egyptian man), in the midst of the sons of Israel, and strive in the camp do the son of the Israelitish woman and a man of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the son of the Israelitish woman execrateth the Name, and revileth; and they bring him in unto Moses; and his mother's name [is] Shelomith daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he causeth him to rest in charge -- to explain to them by the mouth of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Bring out the reviler unto the outside of the camp; and all those hearing have laid their hands on his head, and all the company have stoned him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And unto the sons of Israel thou dost speak, saying, When any man revileth his God -- then he hath borne his sin;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he who is execrating the name of Jehovah is certainly put to death; all the company do certainly cast stones at him; as a sojourner so a native, in his execrating the Name, is put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man smiteth any soul of man, he is certainly put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he who smiteth a beast repayeth it, body for body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man putteth a blemish in his fellow, as he hath done so it is done to him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: breach for breach, eye for eye, tooth for tooth; as he putteth a blemish in a man so it is done in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he who smiteth a beast repayeth it, and he who smiteth [the life of] man is put to death;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one judgment is to you; as a sojourner so is a native; for I [am] Jehovah your God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses speaketh unto the sons of Israel, and they bring out the reviler unto the outside of the camp, and stone him with stones; and the sons of Israel have done as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, in mount Sinai, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, and thou hast said unto them, When ye come in unto the land which I am giving to you, then hath the land kept a sabbath to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Six years thou dost sow thy field, and six years thou dost prune thy vineyard, and hast gathered its increase,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the seventh year a sabbath of rest is to the land, a sabbath to Jehovah; thy field thou dost not sow, and thy vineyard thou dost not prune;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the spontaneous growth of thy harvest thou dost not reap, and the grapes of thy separated thing thou dost not gather, a year of rest it is to the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the sabbath of the land hath been to you for food, to thee, and to thy man-servant, and to thy handmaid, and to thy hireling, and to thy settler, who are sojourning with thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to thy cattle, and to the beast which [is] in thy land, is all thine increase for food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast numbered to thee seven sabbaths of years, seven years seven times, and the days of the seven sabbaths of years have been to thee nine and forty years,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast caused a trumpet of shouting to pass over in the seventh month, in the tenth of the month; in the day of the atonements ye do cause a trumpet to pass over through all your land;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have hallowed the year, the fiftieth year; and ye have proclaimed liberty in the land to all its inhabitants; a jubilee it is to you; and ye have turned back each unto his possession; yea, each unto his family ye do turn back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `A jubilee it [is], the fiftieth year, a year it is to you; ye sow not, nor reap its spontaneous growth, nor gather its separated things;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for a jubilee it [is], holy it is to you; out of the field ye eat its increase;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the year of this jubilee ye turn back each unto his possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when thou sellest anything to thy fellow, or buyest from the hand of thy fellow, ye do not oppress one another;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by the number of years after the jubilee thou dost buy from thy fellow; by the number of the years of increase he doth sell to thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: according to the multitude of the years thou dost multiply its price, and according to the fewness of the years thou dost diminish its price; for a number of increases he is selling to thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye do not oppress one another, and thou hast been afraid of thy God; for I [am] Jehovah your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye have done My statutes, and My judgments ye keep, and have done them, and ye have dwelt on the land confidently,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the land hath given its fruit, and ye have eaten to satiety, and have dwelt confidently on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when ye say, What do we eat in the seventh year, lo, we do not sow, nor gather our increase?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I have commanded My blessing on you in the sixth year, and it hath made the increase for three years;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have sown the eighth year, and have eaten of the old increase; until the ninth year, until the coming in of its increase, ye do eat the old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the land is not sold -- to extinction, for the land [is] Mine, for sojourners and settlers [are] ye with Me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in all the land of your possession a redemption ye do give to the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thy brother becometh poor, and hath sold his possession, then hath his redeemer who is near unto him come, and he hath redeemed the sold thing of his brother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when a man hath no redeemer, and his own hand hath attained, and he hath found as sufficient [for] its redemption,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he hath reckoned the years of its sale, and hath given back that which is over to the man to whom he sold [it], and he hath returned to his possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if his hand hath not found sufficiency to give back to him, then hath his sold thing been in the hand of him who buyeth it till the year of jubilee; and it hath gone out in the jubilee, and he hath returned to his possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man selleth a dwelling-house [in] a walled city, then hath his right of redemption been until the completion of a year from its selling; days -- is his right of redemption;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if it is not redeemed until the fulness to him of a perfect year, then hath the house which [is] in a walled city been established to extinction to the buyer of it, to his generations; it goeth not out in the jubilee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a house of the villages which have no wall round about, on the field of the country is reckoned; redemption is to it, and in the jubilee it goeth out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `As to cities of the Levites -- houses of the cities of their possession -- redemption age-during is to the Levites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as to him who redeemeth from the Levites, both the sale of a house and the city of his possession have gone out in the jubilee, for the houses of the cities of the Levites are their possession in the midst of the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a field, a suburb of their cities, is not sold; for a possession age-during it [is] to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when thy brother is become poor, and his hand hath failed with thee, then thou hast kept hold on him, sojourner and settler, and he hath lived with thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou takest no usury from him, or increase; and thou hast been afraid of thy God; and thy brother hath lived with thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thy money thou givest not to him in usury, and for increase thou givest not thy food;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I [am] Jehovah your God, who hath brought you out of the land of Egypt, to give to you the land of Canaan, to become your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when thy brother becometh poor with thee, and he hath been sold to thee, thou dost not lay on him servile service;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as an hireling, as a settler, he is with thee, till the year of the jubilee he doth serve with thee, --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he hath gone out from thee, he and his sons with him, and hath turned back unto his family; even unto the possession of his fathers he doth turn back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `For they [are] My servants, whom I have brought out from the land of Egypt: they are not sold [with] the sale of a servant;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou rulest not over him with rigour, and thou hast been afraid of thy God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thy man-servant and thy handmaid whom thou hast [are] of the nations who [are] round about you; of them ye buy man-servant and handmaid,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also of the sons of the settlers who are sojourning with you, of them ye buy, and of their families who [are] with you, which they have begotten in your land, and they have been to you for a possession;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have taken them for inheritance to your sons after you, to occupy [for] a possession; to the age ye lay service upon them, but upon your brethren, the sons of Israel, one with another, thou dost not rule over him with rigour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when the hand of a sojourner or settler with thee attaineth [riches], and thy brother with him hath become poor, and he hath been sold to a sojourner, a settler with thee, or to the root of the family of a sojourner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: after he hath been sold, there is a right of redemption to him; one of his brethren doth redeem him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or his uncle, or a son of his uncle, doth redeem him, or any of the relations of his flesh, of his family, doth redeem him, or -- his own hand hath attained -- then he hath been redeemed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he hath reckoned with his buyer from the year of his being sold to him till the year of jubilee, and the money of his sale hath been by the number of years; as the days of an hireling it is with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `If yet many years, according to them he giveth back his redemption [money], from the money of his purchase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if few are left of the years till the year of jubilee, then he hath reckoned with him, according to his years he doth give back his redemption [money];
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as an hireling, year by year, he is with him, and he doth not rule him with rigour before thine eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if he is not redeemed in these [years], then he hath gone out in the year of jubilee, he and his sons with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to Me [are] the sons of Israel servants; My servants they [are], whom I have brought out of the land of Egypt; I, Jehovah, [am] your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Ye do not make to yourselves idols; and graven image or standing image ye do not set up to yourselves; and a stone of imagery ye do not put in your land, to bow yourselves to it; for I [am] Jehovah your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `My sabbaths ye do keep, and My sanctuary ye do reverence; I [am] Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `If in My statutes ye walk, and My commands ye keep, and have done them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I have given your rains in their season, and the land hath given her produce, and the tree of the field doth give its fruit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and reached to you hath the threshing, the gathering, and the gathering doth reach the sowing-[time]; and ye have eaten your bread to satiety, and have dwelt confidently in your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I have given peace in the land, and ye have lain down, and there is none causing trembling; and I have caused evil beasts to cease out of the land, and the sword doth not pass over into your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye have pursued your enemies, and they have fallen before you by the sword;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and five of you have pursued a hundred, and a hundred of you do pursue a myriad; and your enemies have fallen before you by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I have turned unto you, and have made you fruitful, and have multiplied you, and have established My covenant with you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have eaten old [store], and the old because of the new ye bring out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I have given My tabernacle in your midst, and My soul doth not loathe you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have walked habitually in your midst, and have become your God, and ye -- ye are become My people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I [am] Jehovah your God, who have brought you out of the land of the Egyptians, from being their servants; and I break the bars of your yoke, and cause you to go erect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if ye do not hearken to Me, and do not all these commands;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if at My statutes ye kick, and if My judgments your soul loathe, so as not to do all My commands -- to your breaking My covenant --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also do this to you, and I have appointed over you trouble, the consumption, and the burning fever, consuming eyes, and causing pain of soul; and your seed in vain ye have sowed, and your enemies have eaten it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have set My face against you, and ye have been smitten before your enemies; and those hating you have ruled over you, and ye have fled, and there is none pursuing you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if unto these ye hearken not to Me, -- then I have added to chastise you seven times for your sins;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have broken the pride of your strength, and have made your heavens as iron, and your earth as brass;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and consumed hath been your strength in vain, and your land doth not give her produce, and the tree of the land doth not give its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if ye walk with Me [in] opposition, and are not willing to hearken to Me, then I have added to you a plague seven times, according to your sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sent against you the beast of the field, and it hath bereaved you; and I have cut off your cattle, and have made you few, and your ways have been desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if by these ye are not instructed by Me, and have walked with Me [in] opposition,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I have walked -- I also -- with you in opposition, and have smitten you, even I, seven times for your sins;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have brought in on you a sword, executing the vengeance of a covenant; and ye have been gathered unto your cities, and I have sent pestilence into your midst, and ye have been given into the hand of an enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `In My breaking to you the staff of bread, then ten women have baked your bread in one oven, and have given back your bread by weight; and ye have eaten, and are not satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if for this ye hearken not to Me, and have walked with Me in opposition,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I have walked with you in the fury of opposition, and have chastised you, even I, seven times for your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye have eaten the flesh of your sons; even flesh of your daughters ye do eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have destroyed your high places, and cut down your images, and have put your carcases on the carcases of your idols, and My soul hath loathed you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have made your cities a waste, and have made desolate your sanctuaries, and I smell not at your sweet fragrances;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have made desolate the land, and your enemies, who are dwelling in it, have been astonished at it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you I scatter among nations, and have drawn out after you a sword, and your land hath been a desolation, and your cities are a waste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Then doth the land enjoy its sabbaths -- all the days of the desolation, and ye in the land of your enemies -- then doth the land rest, and hath enjoyed its sabbaths;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the days of the desolation it resteth that which it hath not rested in your sabbaths in your dwelling on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And those who are left of you -- I have also brought a faintness into their heart in the lands of their enemies, and the sound of a leaf driven away hath pursued them, and they have fled -- flight from a sword -- and they have fallen, and there is none pursuing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they have stumbled one on another, as from the face of a sword, and there is none pursuing, and ye have no standing before your enemies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have perished among the nations, and the land of your enemies hath consumed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And those who are left of you -- they consume away in their iniquity, in the lands of your enemies; and also in the iniquities of their fathers, with them they consume away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And -- they have confessed their iniquity, and the iniquity of their fathers, in their trespass which they have trespassed against Me, and also, that they have walked with Me, in opposition,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also I walk to them in opposition, and have brought them into the land of their enemies -- or then their uncircumcised heart is humbled, and then they accept the punishment of their iniquity, --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I have remembered My covenant [with] Jacob, and also My covenant [with] Isaac, and also My covenant [with] Abraham I remember, and the land I remember.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And -- the land is left of them, and doth enjoy its sabbaths, in the desolation without them, and they accept the punishment of their iniquity, because, even because, against My judgments they have kicked, and My statutes hath their soul loathed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also even this, in their being in the land of their enemies, I have not rejected them, nor have I loathed them, to consume them, to break My covenant with them; for I [am] Jehovah their God; --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I have remembered for them the covenant of the ancestors, whom I brought forth out of the land of Egypt before the eyes of the nations to become their God; I [am] Jehovah.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These [are] the statutes, and the judgments, and the laws, which Jehovah hath given between Him and the sons of Israel, in mount Sinai, by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, and thou hast said unto them, When a man maketh a wonderful vow, by thy valuation the persons [are] Jehovah's.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When thy valuation hath been of the male from a son of twenty years even unto a son of sixty years, then hath been thy valuation fifty shekels of silver by the shekel of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if it [is] a female -- then hath thy valuation been thirty shekels;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if from a son of five years even unto a son of twenty years -- then hath thy valuation been of the male twenty shekels, and for the female, ten shekels;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if from a son of a month even unto a son of five years -- then hath thy valuation been of the male five shekels of silver, and for the female thy valuation [is] three shekels of silver;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if from a son of sixty years and above -- if a male, then hath thy valuation been fifteen shekels, and for a female, ten shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if he is poorer than thy valuation, then he hath presented himself before the priest, and the priest hath valued him; according to that which the hand of him who is vowing doth reach doth the priest value him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if [it is] a beast of which they bring near an offering to Jehovah, all that [one] giveth of it to Jehovah is holy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he doth not change it nor exchange it, a good for a bad, or a bad for a good; and if he really change beast for beast, -- then it hath been -- it and its exchange is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if [it is] any unclean beast of which they do not bring near an offering to Jehovah, then he hath presented the beast before the priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath valued it; whether good or bad, according to thy valuation, O priest, so it is;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if he really redeem it, then he hath added its fifth to thy valuation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man sanctifieth his house, a holy thing to Jehovah, then hath the priest valued it, whether good or bad; as the priest doth value it so it standeth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if he who is sanctifying doth redeem his house, then he hath added a fifth of the money of thy valuation to it, and it hath become his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if of the field of his possession a man sanctify to Jehovah, then hath thy valuation been according to its seed; a homer of barley-seed at fifty shekels of silver;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if from the year of the jubilee he sanctify his field, according to thy valuation it standeth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if after the jubilee he sanctify his field, then hath the priest reckoned to him the money according to the years which are left, unto the year of the jubilee, and it hath been abated from thy valuation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if he really redeem the field -- he who is sanctifying it -- then he hath added a fifth of the money of thy valuation to it, and it hath been established to him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if he do not redeem the field, or if he hath sold the field to another man, it is not redeemed any more;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the field hath been, in its going out in the jubilee, holy to Jehovah as a field which is devoted; to the priest is its possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if the field of his purchase (which [is] not of the fields of his possession) [one] sanctify to Jehovah --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hath the priest reckoned to him the amount of thy valuation unto the year of jubilee, and he hath given thy valuation in that day -- a holy thing to Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the year of the jubilee the field returneth to him from whom he bought it, to him whose [is] the possession of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all thy valuation is by the shekel of the sanctuary: twenty gerahs is the shekel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Only, a firstling which is Jehovah's firstling among beasts -- no man doth sanctify it, whether ox or sheep; it [is] Jehovah's.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if among the unclean beasts, then he hath ransomed [it] at thy valuation, and he hath added its fifth to it; and if it is not redeemed, then it hath been sold at thy valuation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Only, no devoted thing which a man devoteth to Jehovah, of all that he hath, of man, and beast, and of the field of his possession, is sold or redeemed; every devoted thing is most holy to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `No devoted thing, which is devoted of man, is ransomed, it is surely put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all tithe of the land, of the seed of the land, of the fruit of the tree, is Jehovah's -- holy to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if a man really redeem [any] of his tithe, its fifth he addeth to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And all the tithe of the herd and of the flock -- all that passeth by under the rod -- the tenth is holy to Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he enquireth not between good and bad, nor doth he change it; and if he really change it -- then it hath been -- it and its exchange is holy; it is not redeemed.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These [are] the commands which Jehovah hath commanded Moses for the sons of Israel, in mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator
